Name.label: Torsade-de-pointes syndrome with short coupling interval

TextSection.Contents: Torsade-de-pointes (TdP) syndrome with short coupling interval is a very rare variant of Torsade de pointes, a polymorphic ventricular tachycardia, which is characterized by a short coupling interval of the first TdP beat on electrocardiogram in the absence of any structural heart disease. It manifests in early adulthood with syncope, often results in ventricular fibrillation and shows a high risk of sudden cardiac death.

Name.label: E (exact mapping (the terms and the concepts are equivalent))
